website_summaries.verdict: If you just need a simple, 1-step stool that's inexpensive and easy to store, this is a fantastic choice. Incredibly affordable and highly functional.
pros: This one comes packed with features: compact, easy to fold and unfold, and holds plenty of weight
All of this at a great price makes it a solid choice for plenty of tasks
cons: The 8" height is not suited for tasks that require a higher climb

customer_reviews.title: Not well thought out!!
customer_reviews.text: I initially liked this item as it has portability & takes up little space. However after using in it in different areas of the house I wound up putting it out in the shed. it is very dangerous. it doesn't stay locked in place & is very tippy. It is now a plant holder on the patio.
customer_reviews.author: Jjram

customer_reviews.title: Great support, awesome stool
customer_reviews.text: We have tall cabinets, so I had a similar stool for that job. I bought this one to go under my office desk as a foot rest. However, after realizing this stool was infinitely sturdier, this has become my kitchen height assistant. I am not small nor short and weigh...let’s just say “a lot”. My other stool, I would stand on the edges, as a I was afraid it was going to break. Not this one, strong as can be. It folds up nicely and packs away in a cabinet with ease. I dare say this is my favorite kitchen gadget.
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bathroom step stool for young kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a bathroom stool for my 3-year-old and 6-year-old to use to help them reach the sink. It is lightweight and folds up easily, but we just leave it unfolded all the time. It has a small profile so we're not always tripping over it like some of our other step stools, yet it's also sturdy enough that neither child has ever tumbled from it, knocked it over, or had it slide out from under them. It's perfect for our needs and I would buy another.
customer_reviews.author: MissHannigan

customer_reviews.title: Handy, lightweight little step stool
customer_reviews.text: Much better than I thought it was going to be. Very easy to unfold, and easy to fold. My sister has arthritis and can easily carry and use this. Very lightweight. I don't remember if weight limit is listed, but my 265lb son used it, and there was no flexing in the stair. He only used it that once though. My sister uses it to help her into bed.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect secure step stool for the elderly
customer_reviews.text: Perfect secure step stool for the elderly! I got this step stool for my 90 yr old mother so she could get in and out of our car, and it's great! It's the distance of a regular step and is very sturdy and well-made so I didn't have to worry about her falling (she doesn't worry either!) as she steps on and off of it. I like the way it folds up quite easily, small, flat and compact, so I can simply store it in a small niche in the car when it's not in use.
customer_reviews.author: muushuu10

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help me get into our full size pickup. It works well. Gives me the one step up I needed, folds easily and because of the design I can reach down to pick it up, fold and store it next to me easily. Seems sturdy enough for my purpose. Old age is no fun and this allows me to get into the truck with no help.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzz

customer_reviews.title: Quick -Fold Step Stool  is exactly that...
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's the perfect height for me to get into my bed, or get things off a shelf or out of kitchen cabinets. Light weight and folds easily means my old dog can get into that car,too, then later it's back indoors by my bed. I'm really very pleased .
customer_reviews.author: Demi

customer_reviews.title: Easy, sturdy and small enough to store anywhere.
customer_reviews.text: Love my step ladder. It’s just the extra boost I need to reach my higher shelves. I’m 5’1” and am not nimble enough anymore to climb up on the kitchen counter to reach things. Bought a second one to use in the RV. Easy to fold and close too. Do small it easily tucks out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: MNmomof3

customer_reviews.title: Very low at only 8 inches tall. Side handles get in the way.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use to reach tall kitchen cabinets. This is listed as "8-inch standard step height." I accepted that eight inches is the standard height for a step stool, based on this description. It is not. This step stool is very low. Also, the side handles add nothing except things to trip over. There is no added security with these and they get in the way. It was not worth returning this but I bought a Greenco folding step stool, which is 11 inches tall, without dangerous side handles, better made and safer.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Makes a good footrest, too.
customer_reviews.text: Use this under my desk in my office as a foot rest (ergonomic foot rests are insanely expensive). It works great, the only problem I have is if I move around too much sometimes it collapses on me. I don't see that being an issue if you're using it as a step stool, though. Being able to put my feet up has really helped my lower back pain :)
customer_reviews.author: ChristaMae

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but a little dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I have had this stool for a long time and it has many good features. It folds up small and it feels very secure. The only problem is that I have caught my foot in the triangle of the side many times. I am more careful when I step down now. I would reccomend it but just realize you need to step off carefully.
customer_reviews.author: elncyr

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for cheap
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy, has rubber no-silp feet, and is not very expensive. We found this was a much better choice for our daughter's bathroom step stool than any of those marketed specifically for kids. In addition, the weight limit is over 200 lbs, so we could use it, too, if needed.
customer_reviews.author: M. Finley

customer_reviews.title: Below expectations
customer_reviews.text: I am no where near the weight limit claimed but I could feel it give when I stepped on it. Not sure I will keep it. Folds and unfolds awkwardly, too.
customer_reviews.author: Randal S.

customer_reviews.title: A very helpful addition!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a footstool that I could stow in my bedroom so I could reach the upper shelves in my closet, and this does the trick. Gives me just enough height to reach the top shelf and folds up quickly. But I discovered a secondary use for it as a place to rest my feet under my desk, so I almost never fold it up -- just put a pillow on top on which to rest my feet, and I stow it under my desk. And when I'm standing on it, I never feel unsteady or as though it's going to collapse. It is quite sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Reality Based Skeptic

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and stores easily
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy step stool that is perfect for anyone who needs a lift reaching the top shelf of a kitchen cabinet or closet shelf. Unlike larger step stools, this one folds up nearly flat and takes up very little space when it is stored away. To use, simply open and snap the top step into place. It is very stable, comes in handy for quick needs and cleans up easily. No more treks out to the garage for my larger step stool, which still serves its purpose. But for quick, easy use in a kitchen, bath or bedroom, this is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: Step stool
customer_reviews.text: I got a new bed and mattress and was having a tough time getting in the bed at night. I ordered this step stool and it is perfect. It's the perfect height and I can fold it in the morning and set it out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: A.McClung

customer_reviews.title: very nice built
customer_reviews.text: My wife get this to get in bet, when she was pregnant it was a little unaccountable for her get in bed so she buy this product and from that moment she haven stop using it,
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Pena

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This step folds up good. Not too sure about the sturdiness because it is used for a lightweight person. It is very good for them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight yet sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I needed a step up for my car, this is good with the 'handles' on either side, in order to grab it once I am seated. So far it seems sturdy enough, since I have spinal issues and arthritis in all my joints, I remain leery of it slipping on some surfaces. Also it is very narrow. There is barely enough room for both feet on the step. I have regular width, size 8 shoes. I am not sure it will be so helpful in winter on slippery surfaces and with my snow boots on.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy little stool that holds my ample weight. I like that it folds down for easy storage. I got it to help climb into my sons truck. I haven't used it for that yet, but it has helped reach items in the top cupboards. Before I had it, I would either do without, or do something dangerous to reach those shelves. I had a 2 step stool but it was a pain in the neck to get out. I like this one.
customer_reviews.author: wlr/buddysbuddy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect height for inside the house
customer_reviews.text: As a guy who only stands at 5'5", this step stool is perfect to use to reach high shelves in our kitchen and the top areas of our walk-in closet. It's lightweight, sturdy, and looks nice enough that you're not hiding it every second you get. I feel really stable on the stool, even when standing with both feet. It folds up really neat and does the job. Great option for getting at things that are "juuuuust" out of reach.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Chung

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy foldaway step up.
customer_reviews.text: Feels sturdy even under the weight of person weighing around 200 lbs. It doesn't creak or buckle during use, but it does tend to slide a bit on bare floors because there are no anti-skid guards on the feet- so you'll need to be careful with this or add some nonskid covers to the feet if using on bare floors. Overall nice step up stool.
customer_reviews.author: U Dont Know Me

customer_reviews.title: We have this for use on our boat in the stateroom
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy lightweight stool. We use it to reach our bed in our stateroom on the boat! I love how small it folds up so it can be stowed away!
customer_reviews.author: Yacht Girl

customer_reviews.title: AID FOR THE ELDERLY
customer_reviews.text: MY WIFE RECENTLY PURCHASED A REPLICA OF THE OLD SOUTH RICE BED. WHEN ASSEMBLED THIS BED STANDS APPX. 36" FROM THE FLOOR TO THE TOP OF THE MATTRESS. THIS MAKES GETTING INTO BED QUITE CHALLENGING UNLESS YOU ARE AN OLYMPIC GYMNAST. WE STARTED LOOKING FOR BED STOOLS AND WERE SHOCKED TO DISCOVER MANY SOLD FOR OVER $100. WE DISCOVERED THIS STOOL ONLINE AND WERE PLEASED WITH THE APPEARANCE AND FUNCTIIONALITY OF THIS PRODUCT. MY ONLY COMPLAINT IS THAT I WOULD PREFER THE STOOL BE SEVERAL INCHES WIDER.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Quick Fold Stool
customer_reviews.text: There are two little prongs that lock the top in place; kind of hard to engage and look pretty fragile. If the stool warps, they aren't going to stay in place. I wanted something that folds flat for easy storage, and this isn't really flat. The step is just a bit high and a bit narrow side to side for me to feel comfortable using it. So I haven't. I have used it as a foot stool, however. Someone younger and more agile might find it friendlier.
customer_reviews.author: Onlineshopper

customer_reviews.title: Mechanic
customer_reviews.text: Looks a little like a mechanic's stool but hey - what's not to like? It works AND it folds up - so it's right handy. Believe it or not, I had a little trouble figuring out how to exactly unfold it - but my husband helped me. (LOL)! and now - I keep it folded up right by that top shelf in my kitchen that I can't reach. The stool is just the uplift I need. Nice and sturdy and I can put both feet on it at the same time. Woo Hoo!
customer_reviews.author: Carmelene

customer_reviews.title: Yay
customer_reviews.text: Great stool! It is very sturdy. I've never felt uncomfortable or unstable on it. It doubles as a booster and a squatty potty in our house :) (its about the same height as the squatty potty and like half the price... does the job)
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it folds up so I can store it in an out of the way place in the kitchen where it is very handy to get to when needed. It seems sturdy when stood on. Overall I like it, the only slight quibble I have is that it is a little finicky when setting it up to get the thing to sit on the floor where all four feet are flat on the floor. It often will be a little uneven when you set it down so it often takes some adjusting to get it to sit flat. Maybe over time it will loosen up a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits under a seat.
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted it for our minivan, to accommodate elderly passengers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you are really looking for something sturdy..
customer_reviews.text: It's fairly cheaply made, not really worth more than the $9 bucks I paid ... The sides may get in your way as they do for me and it's ability to fold is sort of cock-eyed. However it's ok for what I needed at the moment while I look for another. If you are really looking for something sturdy ... this may not be the one.
customer_reviews.author: cth - SC

customer_reviews.title: The stool is great - this is the second I have bought BUT ...
customer_reviews.text: The stool is great - this is the second I have bought BUT I nearly killed myself as I stepped on the stool and it slid across the room! On inspection, the little stoppers on the bottom of each leg were missing! YIKIES!
customer_reviews.author: carol s

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy little step. We bought it for our camper because it folds flat and will store in a very small space. I was disappointed to find a disparity in price according to color. Black was not my first color choice, but I was not willing to pay more for the same item in a different color. Although there are times when the step is not quite high enough, it works very well in most situations. The step locks into the open position and appears quite sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: crznszn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect one step for the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: So handy to keep (folded) nex to the fridge. Gets me to the top of the shelves and stays out of the way when I don't need it.
customer_reviews.author: Leos mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Step stool
customer_reviews.text: I love this step stool. I am 5 feet tall and I always have a problem reaching things in the upper shelves of my cabinet. I keep it in my kitchen for that reason and it has helped a lot. I bought it because it is black and looks nicer than most step stools I've seen.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Well Made & Folds Nicely
customer_reviews.text: This little step stool is all plastic but well made and folds nicely so that it can tucked away. My wife loves having it around the kitchen to access higher shelves. However, despite the fact that the product description says, "holds up to 300-pound securely and safely," I would be hesitant to recommend it to anyone who weighs north of 200-pounds as I (a relative lightweight) do notice some give in the step and the legs.
customer_reviews.author: Walter H.

customer_reviews.title: one step foot stool
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fold and set up. Cost is very reasonable and delivery was quick. It was purchased to elevate one with a hip replacement to get in a pickup truck. It was plenty sturdy and easy to store. However, the side rails hindered rotating on the stool which was necessary to position ones self to get in the truck. I should have noticed the rails in the photo provided. For straight up and down stepping, it should be excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Dapip

customer_reviews.title: Great for my closet!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and I feel very sturdy on it.
customer_reviews.author: GPerry

customer_reviews.title: Keeps me independen and safe
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for step up to add 5 inches to height!
customer_reviews.author: AMC

customer_reviews.title: Great for helping little ones to reach sink as well as helping older adults reach things slighty out of reach. Quality material.
customer_reviews.text: Brought this for myself to help reach those things that were accessible few years ago, until I began to shrink with age. Now those items that started to be slightly out of reach now, are fully obtainable and more importantly obtainable in a safe way. Folds right up flat and ever so handy. Highly recommend this product. Durable hard Plastic stays put no slipping just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Suzette Trimmer

customer_reviews.title: Light but Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom to help her get onto her high bed. This was perfect! The step stool was just the right height and is light but sturdy. It folds away easily in the mornings when she isn't using it.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Get the job done
customer_reviews.text: We use this as a stool for our 2 and 4 year old to reach the sink. It didn't even occur to me when I bought this that the folding mechanics might be a problem, but the fact that the actual standing area lift up and clicks back into place has caused a couple of close calls with my kids fingers. Not to mention when not clicked into place properly there are balancing issues for them. We just leave it open all the time now.
customer_reviews.author: Niphaphone

customer_reviews.title: I'm short
customer_reviews.text: I installed a closet organizer system in my closet. Unfortunately it was hard to reach the top shelf after it was installed. I purchased this bad boy step stool, and now I can easily access my stuff. Thanks Step Stool, Black. (Better than purchasing one of those claws old people use to reach stuff up high)
customer_reviews.author: adubz44

customer_reviews.title: Little step, big help!
customer_reviews.text: Great little step! Stable and sturdy. Bought because I have trouble getting into our truck. Love that it folds up and stows easily.
customer_reviews.author: Michel Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, no wobbles, packs up small
customer_reviews.text: Handiest little stool I have had. Just enough to let me reach above the fridge or over the stove. Easy to stow and pack, even in a camper. Lets me reach the propane jugs. Right now I use it mostly for putting paper in my printer since it is up on a shelf and I can't reach the paper slot without it. Has held almost 200 pounds without complaint. Easy to fold up.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't use it to sit
customer_reviews.text: Had to return as it did not fit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lee

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stool for in front of my camper step. At times we are camped in places where the front step of my camper is just a little to high for me. I have used it several times and it works well. It stay's put and holds my weight well. Adams Manufacturing has done a good job on this product. I wish they would make a wider one for just the use I mentioned. This one also stores flat and takes up very little room.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L. Bishop-bell

customer_reviews.title: Nothing exciting here. I had purchased this as an ...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing exciting here. I had purchased this as an aid for my father to get into my SUV but it is a little too awkward for him to maneuver so i purchased an 'outdoor step' instead which works perfectly. I kept this stool in the house for my own use. It is lightweight and folds conveniently.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, wide step stool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our son to use so he can help with cooking and baking. It is sturdy and wide enough that he feels confident when he's standing on it, and it doesn't slide around on the floor. My only complaint is that it doesn't open smoothly - it kind of sticks as it opens and has to be pushed on each side. This means it's not easy for my son (age 8) to open on his own. I am hoping it will become easier to open with use.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I only gave the product 1 star because I couldn’t rate it any lower. Only used 2 times & it broke as I stepped onto it. I am 140lbs & it didn’t hold up. Very flimsy & poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: super
customer_reviews.text: I just love my folding step stool. It is light weight and ideal for even raising up my legs to give better circulation in my legs. This way, I can put up my feet and sit back and read a good book.
customer_reviews.author: jane2222

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for reaching into deep washing machine.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small low folding stool to get the laundry out of the new deep washing machine. Tried a number of different ones they were all too high, so I almost hitting my head on the ceiling and was too high to reach so low.This height is perfect and be able to fold it so it isn`t in the way is great too!
customer_reviews.author: January 19

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for occasional use to help get in and out of bed at home, after surgery. I weigh about 200 pounds, and did not have problems with this step stool, but I wouldn't put a lot of weight on it frequently. tI also tends to fold up if tou are not careful. Overall, it is a good buy for the price and I plan to keep it.
customer_reviews.author: 1409clay

customer_reviews.title: handy stool
customer_reviews.text: good compact stool to lug around the house. folds into a compact sleek space. However, it is not very tall something I realized only after I had it delivered. I know the dimensions are mentioned et al but seeing it physically in front was a bit of a surprise... its sturdy design makes me want to keep it... with a bit of tipping on the toes my wife who is 5'3" is able to reach the topmost shelves in the kitchen
customer_reviews.author: Kaustav Mukherjee

customer_reviews.title: BEST BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: A super buy for a nonobtrusive stool next to the bed. I can fold it up and slide under the bed. Have a third row of seats in the car and this makes access easy and then it fold it up and away we go!!
customer_reviews.author: Merrie Kaiserman

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this
customer_reviews.text: Wife got this so she can have help to get into bed, and it worked until a few days ago when it collapsed and broke and our cat who is 10lbs is the only pet to jump on it. Very disappointed in this.
customer_reviews.author: MamaBear040582

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Stool
customer_reviews.text: This was EXACTLY what I was looking for--a sturdy little stool that is lightweight and ready to tag along on any trip. I need it especially to get into higher vehicles and high hotel beds. This is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: SKCWriter

customer_reviews.title: nice, small sturdy step
customer_reviews.text: i got this to help me step up to a raised planter. It is a good height, it's sturdy and it folds for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: It is just perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little step stool for Grandma next door, who is 83. She was having a hard time getting into her son-in-laws truck. When I opened the box, I was afraid the stool might be too little. But it was just perfect...one step up and she's in! And they love how it folds flat for storage in the back seat area of the truck. Great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marsha B in MO

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy to Have
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of feeling secure on a plastic stool, and a FOLDING one at that! But I really needed a space saving stool to be handy in the kitchen. This stool fits that need perfectly, and feels capable when you stand on it. (But do make sure that it is completely unfolded before using, or else when you stand on it it will snap into place and startle you into thinking it is breaking!)
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Romero

customer_reviews.title: Small enough to keep it handy in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little stool. I use it in the kitchen and then as a foot rest on my patio...LOVE it !!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful underpriced product.  I aim to buy more.
customer_reviews.text: Just ten dollars? Rubbermaid stool is twice that, and it doesn't have the side bumpers this one does. Black is better. A visitor has a really bad foot. The side 'stops' help him be comfortable. I am going to keep this by my wood stove so I don't have to squat to handle the wood ... hurray.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Sandstrom

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!!
customer_reviews.text: Good & sturdy folding step!!! Sturdier than most folding steps that I was finding locally. Needed to assist with me getting into bed after abdominal surgery, fit the task perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: SuziH18

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy little step stool
customer_reviews.text: The man who owned my house before me was about 6'5" and put the closet light over the door. For him it was a piece of cake to turn on ... not so easy for me. I couldn't reach it even standing on my toes. This little stool has done the trick. It doesn't take up much space and is sturdy enough to feel secure hopping up on it.
customer_reviews.author: lcvincent

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, folds up into a slender
customer_reviews.text: Handy, sturdy, folds up into a slender, flat shape that stands up on its own. Great for reaching the top shelves of kitchen and bathroom cupboards.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Marinkovich

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: This little step is exactly what I need to be able to get into my bed
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Cantrell

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, sturdy step stool
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this a few times, because that's all I've needed it for, but I have little doubt that this will last me for a long time. It's small, it's easy to set up and fold, it fits nicely between the wall and the refrigerator. The weight capacity is hard to beat, even with a metal step stool, unless you want to pay a lot more. I'm very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Jon M

customer_reviews.title: lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This is a good sturdy step stool. I use it to reach the top level of my closet. Its light weight and easy to move and kick around if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Cunnelli

customer_reviews.title: great stool. it certainly isn't as pretty as some ...
customer_reviews.text: great stool. it certainly isn't as pretty as some others. it looks like it should be in a garage or a work site, but when I am not using it, it folds up nicely. it is extremely sturdy and I don't foresee it breaking on me anytime soon. The others cracked in a matter of months.
customer_reviews.author: Forever Yong

customer_reviews.title: Small light weight and folds for easy storage. Actually a 3 1/2 " space is ...
customer_reviews.text: This little step changed my life. I started at 5'9"" had full spine fusion for curvature of the spine I am now 5'7" and cannot stretch as you can imagine to reach anything. This little step was the answer to my prayers. Small light weight and folds for easy storage. Actually a 3 1/2 " space is perfect. I love it! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: elana

customer_reviews.title: Good step stool for toddlers.
customer_reviews.text: I got this so my 2year old toddler can be able to wash his hands after going potty. I looked at other step stool but they looked to bulky and with a small restroom I knew I wanted something that I can fold up. I found this one and love it. Works great
customer_reviews.author: Blanca Alcazar

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Little Bench!
customer_reviews.text: This little stool was a great find, just had back surgery and needed to be able to get in bed without stretching and this little baby did it’s job. Great quality and worth so much more.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect for this
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a step stool for my 3 year old to use for the toilet when we decided to put the training potty away. It's perfect for this!
customer_reviews.author: katyn

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: The first step up into my RV is too high for my disabled wife, I searched for steps on the RV sites, the cheapest I found was $69.00. Found this on Amazon and it's just what I needed. Lightweight, quick, easy, set-up, and supports the weight of me and my wife, and I'm no light weight. For the price, it can't be beat! And the bonus..... It's USA made!!! Hoo-Aaahh!
customer_reviews.author: Firemanjerry

customer_reviews.title: Great for small bathrooms, potty training kids, use as a seat...
customer_reviews.text: We have a very small bathroom, and I needed a stool for our 3.5 year old to be able to sit properly on the potty (legs/knees at a 90 degree angle). This folds flat nicely and slides right in between the toilet and the wall. My 3.5 year old easily sets it up and it's perfect for when he sits on the potty. It's also great for sitting on when giving the kids baths. I wish it was a bit more aesthetically pleasing, but it serves its purpose very well.
customer_reviews.author: albinorhino

customer_reviews.title: The Right Step UP!
customer_reviews.text: I have one of those fabulous solid wood 4 posted beds and the mattress sits really high up off the ground and I was having trouble getting into bed, until I bought this little step. It's perfect, just the right height to help me get into bed comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Kodybear

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size for the utility room to give me a boost so I can reach over the washer and dryer to the shelves. It is easy to fold, fits between the washer and dryer, and is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Slam

customer_reviews.title: Great Stool for a Tall Bed - Easy to Store
customer_reviews.text: Bought this stool to keep under my lifted queen bed - for my shorter friends! I didn't want one of those wooden ones that has to stay out. This is perfect and weight load makes me feel much better. It folds down quick and easy too.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl L Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Very handy!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little step stool! Has saved my arms and back 100 time over reaching for things on the top shelves! Then folds up flat for storage! It is a handy thing to have in the house, for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy480

customer_reviews.title: No thank you
customer_reviews.text: I needed this step stool to put up lights in my house and even with this stool I was too short to reach the top I have had stools previously and they were high enough, I am not keeping this it didn't feel sturdy at all I was a nervous wreck.
customer_reviews.author: tina

customer_reviews.title: Small Step Stool
customer_reviews.text: Smaller step stool that works out great in the laundry room, kitchen and bedroom. My wife is a smaller person :), and she uses this all over the house. It works great for her in the areas where she can't reach, and its light and solid enough to carry around. Highly recommend for those looking to reach up 6 inches higher.
customer_reviews.author: Donbran

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Cute little step stool. Got it for my grandson to use and it will work just fine. It takes a little maneuvering to get it to lock into place but once it's locked it is very solid. Great little stool for the money.
customer_reviews.author: LoveAtlantaTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: It's too light weight
customer_reviews.text: I got this stool to step on while getting into and out of bed. It is not heavy enough for me to feel secure, and the tiny dots on the bottom to keep it from sliding on hardwood floors are not very effective. It is a nice little stool, and I am sure I will find a use for it, maybe as a plant support.
customer_reviews.author: W Chuck

customer_reviews.title: cheap and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. This step is made of heavy plastic and i believe holds about 300 lbs. It does the job it was designed to do, lift you about 6". There is nothing to steady you but it is well built and won't crumble. Best used close to something you can lean against
customer_reviews.author: AGSJR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I gave it a 5 because it has been the only thing that has worked for me just getting into my truck. After getting in, I reach down and grab the highest point and pick it up and put it in the truck, folded up. Very easy to use and takes up little room. Has made my life much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Very useful little stool
customer_reviews.text: Perfect height for my needs and sturdy too, this little stool folds closed for storage and is easy to set up. Excellent item!
customer_reviews.author: Kate B.

customer_reviews.title: Studier than expected.
customer_reviews.text: As expected, handy, folds up to hidden away. Studier than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Fish

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. I'm a high school teacher who needed an ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. I'm a high school teacher who needed an extra couple of inches in order to write at the uppermost part of my whiteboard. The kids think it's cute that I need a little step-stool. I think it's completely functional and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Davis

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy enough for safety
customer_reviews.text: Terrible - folds too easily with up and down. My employees won't use it as it's too dangerous. I would request refund but now we've used it and I don't want to go through the work to package it back up and send it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Atamian

customer_reviews.title: GOOD STOOL WORTH THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product and worked as described. The reason I gave it 4 stars was it could use a mechanism to lock it into place, and also put traction material on the step to help getting an elderly person up and into a Jeep especially in the wet weather. For average use it ok as is.This stool is light, easy to set up, and stores well in the house or auto.
customer_reviews.author: Dav

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This step is sturdy, yet lightweight. It helps me (an older person) get into my son's SUV and helps my cousin (also older) get into my smaller SUV. It folds fairly easily after you get the hang of it in a small space of the front seat. In the kitchen, I use it for my grandchildren to reach the sink. The only downside is that I wish it had a cord attached to the upper parts (or at least a hole drilled on each side to attach a cord) so that we could pull it into the car instead of reaching head down to pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: c6101mokee

customer_reviews.title: Good step
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these because I have 2 high beds. It works great for people even up to 300 lbs. And it folds up and you can put it under the bed or closet easily. I recommend this step.
customer_reviews.author: preacherskid1971

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use as a step ladder for my mom to get into my SUV and it works beautifully. MAx Capacity of 250 lbs and so far no problems w weight. Also love how compact it is - folds up and can be placed in car floor while not in use. Would highly recommend for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Valdes

customer_reviews.title: now she can reach items in the kitchen better. Seems pretty sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves it, now she can reach items in the kitchen better. Seems pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much, but was pleasantly surprised at how sturdy this little stool turned out to be. Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Diana in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Easy to open and Close
customer_reviews.text: This stool is sturdy, but opening and closing it is a little cumbersome. If this stool were used in the open position all the time, it would not be a problem. The height of the stool was perfect for what I needed it for as it was not too high.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: So far it's working out. I have a higher ...
customer_reviews.text: So far it's working out. I have a higher step stool,but wanted a lower one for the kitchen as I can't even reach my second shelf in the cupboard.
customer_reviews.author: sewnsow

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for safety and well being, one of my best buys!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not reaching oddly. No getting up on counter tops. No lugging out large and heavy step ladders when this fits the bill addressing the above concerns. Small folded away, sturdy and light. my concerns addressed make this an unquestionable value.
customer_reviews.author: music_monger

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I got this little stool to be able to look up on the top cabinet shelf. It's perfect for the job, unfolds easily, is sturdy to stand my 205 lbs on, and is just high enough to do the job for me. It folds up, and is stored between the washer and dryer. Perfect for what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Ripkitty

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stool. I purchased to carry in my car ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome stool. I purchased to carry in my car to aid in putting my kayak in to and out of the roof rack. It's perfect. Lightweight, folds easily and does the job I need. The tread on the stool keeps my feet from slipping.
customer_reviews.author: JT; Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice little footstool but, it is Little. A bit too narrow for my big feet.
customer_reviews.author: Alamo 223

product_meta.title: Adams Manufacturing 8530-02-3731 Quik-Fold Step Stool, Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackIdeal everywhere you need a little step up, including the kitchen, garage, camper, or dorm room. Folding quickly and compactly, the step stool fits neatly into small spaces until needed. Unfolding to a comfortable 8-Inch standard step height, the step stool holds up to 300-pound securely and safely. Proudly made in the USA.
